p: Fermented tea leaf (La-phet) is a unique vegetable that we found in Myanmar [ 53]. It is a typical traditional ingredient in the daily cuisine. It was considered to be beneficial to digestion by the informants. The main species used is Camellia sinensis var. assamica, which is identical to puâ€™er tea in Chinese tea. Fermented tea leaf is also enjoyed as a daily vegetable by the local ethnic people in Yunnan Province, China, North Thailand and Laos [ 54]. Tea leaves were commonly used as a vegetable in ancient Asia [ 55]. The history of cooking tea leaves in Asia can be traced to 2500 years ago from the history, literature and tomb relics of ancient China. Chinese people cooked tea leaves in soup, pickles and congee in the Zhou, Qin and Han Dynasties [ 55].
